SENT.plain: Internal carotid artery (ICA) dissection with tandem internal carotid and middle cerebral artery occlusion may carry a poor prognosis even if intravenous recombinant-tissular plasminogen activator is administered
A better outcome may be expected with the combination of intravenous thrombolysis and endovascular methods (stenting and thromboaspiration)
This procedure was performed in 3 patients who had concurrent ICA dissection and intracerebral occlusion
Endovascular treatment was feasible and safe
All our patients had a good clinical outcome
This potential effective approach may need further validation
